title: BR restore point fails due to "â€œfailed to restore meta files: checksum mismatch" after injecting network partition bw s3 and tikv for 1 hour
body:
## Bug Report

<!-- Thanks for your bug report! Don't worry if you can't fill out all the sections. -->

### What version of TiKV are you using?
/ # /tikv-server -V
TiKV
Release Version:   6.2.0-alpha
Edition:           Community
Git Commit Hash:   5ae20e21af29e6f5c63abbd4db8a481dc04539b6
Git Commit Branch: master
UTC Build Time:    2022-07-15 09:40:20
Rust Version:      rustc 1.62.0-nightly (7c4b47696 2022-04-30)

### What operating system and CPU are you using?
K8S

### Steps to reproduce
1. Run log backup
2. Do full backup
3. Run workload 
4. Inject network partition between TiKV and S3 for 1 hour
5. When chaos finished, wait checkpoint move forward, and do PiTR restore

### What did you expect?
PiTR Restore should succeed

### What did happened?
Though checkpoint move forward after chaos finished, but PiTR Restore failed.

``` # /br restore point --pd dst-tidb-pd:2379 -s "s3://tmp/br-log-backup3652a104-656d-4528-af66-75ade419f1ad/Log" --full-backup-storage "s3://tmp/br-log-backup3652a104-656d-4528-af66-75ade419f1ad/Full"

9b68bbfbfd06929297f055ccc15e204e952290b55c9baeb3bb8a8463c5784dc5: [BR:Common:ErrInvalidMetaFile]invalid metafile"]
